meanings.definition: A shoot or sprout that grows from the base of a plant after it has been cut down.
meanings.sent1: The farmer noticed tiny ratoons emerging from the stump.
meanings.sent2: In the garden, the ratoons added new life to the old tree.
meanings.sent3: The ratoons seemed to play hide and seek with the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The ratoons were like nature's way of saying, 'I will not give up.'
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green ratoons stood out against the brown earth.

meanings.sent1: She carefully ratoons the plants to encourage growth.
meanings.sent2: The farmer ratoons his crops to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent3: The way she ratoons the garden makes it look like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: His dedication to ratooning the fields was unmatched.
meanings.sent5: The fields flourished as he ratooned them with care.
